contentSection.headline: Master Advanced Employment Law Topics
contentSection.description: Special Issues in Employment Law is an intensive half-day program covering wage and hour compliance, wrongful discharge, employment torts, ADR, substance use policies, workplace privacy, and post-employment restrictions—the advanced topics that experienced HR professionals need to master.
benefits: Wage and hour expertise – Remote work off-the-clock risks, commission/bonus overtime calculations, and FLSA compliance
Discharge and tort defense – At-will documentation, retaliation analysis, defamation, and negligent hiring/retention
ADR and workplace policies – Program design, fitness-for-duty testing, privacy/monitoring, and post-employment restrictions
Professional certification – Earn your certificate plus 3.75 SHRM/HRCI/CLE continuing education credits

header.title: What You'll Master in Half a Day
header.description: An advanced employment law framework covering wage and hour, wrongful discharge, torts, ADR, substance use, privacy, and confidentiality protection.

faq.question: What happens after I register?
faq.answer: Within minutes, you'll receive an invoice email. Once payment is processed, you can schedule your complimentary pre-program consultation (10-15 minutes) to discuss employment law challenges you're currently facing. Pre-program materials arrive one week before your session starts.

faq.question: What's the difference between in-person and virtual formats?
faq.answer: Both formats feature the same practicing attorney instructors, current employment law content, and professional credits. In-person provides face-to-face networking with other HR professionals. Virtual delivers the same live instruction via Zoom with full Q&A capability. Choose the format that fits your schedule—the quality and content remain identical.

faq.question: What continuing education credits will I earn?
faq.answer: The half-day program provides 3.75 SHRM/HRCI/CLE credits. Plus, your enrollment includes 12 months of quarterly employment law updates (4 sessions × 1.5 credits each = 6 additional credits), bringing your total to nearly 10 credits.

faq.question: Is this the same as Block III of the Certificate in Employee Relations Law?
faq.answer: Yes. Special Issues in Employment Law is Block III of the full Certificate in Employee Relations Law program. You can take it as a standalone half-day program, or combine it with Comprehensive Labor Relations (Block I) and Discrimination Prevention & Defense (Block II) to earn the full certificate.

faq.question: Why is this program shorter than the other blocks?
faq.answer: Special Issues covers advanced topics that build on foundational employment law knowledge. The half-day format delivers concentrated expertise on wage and hour, workplace torts, ADR, privacy, and post-employment restrictions without repeating fundamentals covered elsewhere.

faq.question: How current is the content?
faq.answer: Very. The curriculum addresses remote/hybrid wage and hour risks, state cannabis laws, CPRA and state privacy regulations, and post-FTC non-compete enforcement. Our instructors update content based on cases they're currently handling.

faq.question: Does the $575 program fee include everything?
faq.answer: Yes. Your enrollment includes all live instruction from practicing employment attorneys, complete program materials, 3.75 continuing education credits, pre-program consultation, 12 months of quarterly employment law updates (4 sessions, $1,588 value), permanent access to updated resources, and alumni benefits for all future programs. The only additional cost would be travel if you choose in-person format.

faq.question: Can I apply this toward the full Certificate in Employee Relations Law?
faq.answer: Yes. Special Issues in Employment Law (Block III) counts toward the full certificate. You can complete the remaining blocks—Comprehensive Labor Relations (Block I) and Discrimination Prevention & Defense (Block II)—at any future session to earn the complete Certificate in Employee Relations Law.
